title: Making a music video on the cheap: from concept to completion
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Video recording - Production and direction
description: Episode of Series "Basic music industry skills". Module 21.2. This program demonstrates how a broadcast quality music video can be made for around $1,000. Shows the operation of a video camera and techniques such as white balance. Australian band Pelican Jed, take the viewer through a step by step analysis of their latest music video, highlighting the roles played by each member of the production team including interviews with the producer and director. The emphasis is to take the viewer from the concept stage to completion; where an idea becomes a reality.
related_objects: Series; S01239; Basic music industry skills; Active; 1993
